t: Jeremiah 14
Drought and a Prayer for Mercy
That*p which came as the word of the Lord*s to Jeremiah in regard to the drought:
“Judah*pn mourns And*ln her gates languish; They*ln sit on the ground in mourning, And*ln the cry of Jerusalem has ascended.

Their*ln nobles have sent their servants for water; They*ln have come to the cisterns and found no water. They*ln have returned with their vessels empty; They*ln have been put to shame and humiliated, And*ln they cover their heads.
Because*ln the ground is cracked, For*ln there has been no rain on the land; The*ln farmers have been put to shame, They*ln have covered their heads.
For*ln even the doe in the field has given birth only to abandon her*i young,*i Because*ln there is no grass.
The*ln wild donkeys stand on the bare heights; They*ln pant for air like jackals, Their*ln eyes fail For*ln there is no vegetation.
Although*ln our iniquities testify against us, O*ln Lord,*s act for Your name’s sake! Truly*ln our apostasies have been many, We*ln have sinned against You.
O*ln Hope of Israel, Its*ln Savior in time of distress, Why*ln are You like a stranger in the land Or*ln like a traveler who has pitched his tent*i for the night?
Why*ln are You like a man dismayed, Like*ln a mighty man who cannot save? Yet*ln You are in our midst, O Lord,*s And*ln we are called by Your name; Do*ln not forsake us!”

Thus*p says the Lord*s to this people, “Even so they have loved to wander; they have not kept their feet in check. Therefore the Lord*s does not accept them; now He will remember their iniquity and call their sins to account.”
So the Lord*s said to me, “Do not pray for the welfare of this people.

When they fast, I am not going to listen to their cry; and when they offer burnt offering and grain offering, I am not going to accept them. Rather I am going to make an end of them by the sword, famine and pestilence.”
False Prophets
But,*p “Ah, Lord God!”*s I said, “Look, the prophets are telling them, ‘You will not see the sword nor will you have famine, but I will give you lasting peace in this place.’ ”

Then the Lord*s said to me, “The prophets are prophesying falsehood in My name. I have neither sent them nor commanded them nor spoken to them; they are prophesying to you a false vision, divination, futility and the deception of their own minds.

Therefore thus says the Lord*s concerning the prophets who are prophesying in My name, although it was not I who sent them—yet they keep saying, ‘There will be no sword or famine in this land’—by sword and famine those prophets shall meet their end!

The people also to whom they are prophesying will be thrown out into the streets of Jerusalem because of the famine and the sword; and there will be no one to bury them— neither*i them, nor*i their wives, nor their sons, nor their daughters—for I will pour out their own*i wickedness on them.

You*pn will say this word to them, ‘Let*ln my eyes flow down with tears night and day, And*ln let them not cease; For*ln the virgin daughter of my people has been crushed with a mighty blow, With*ln a sorely infected wound.

If*ln I go out to the country, Behold,*ln those slain with the sword! Or*ln if I enter the city, Behold,*ln diseases of famine! For*ln both prophet and priest Have*ln gone roving about in the land that they do not know.’ ”

Have*ln You completely rejected Judah? Or*ln have You loathed Zion? Why*ln have You stricken us so that we are beyond healing? We*iln waited for peace, but nothing good came;*i And*ln for a time of healing, but behold, terror!
We*ln know our wickedness, O Lord,*s The*ln iniquity of our fathers, for we have sinned against You.
Do*ln not despise us,*i for Your own name’s sake; Do*ln not disgrace the throne of Your glory; Remember*ln and*i do not annul Your covenant with us.

Are*ln there any among the idols of the nations who give rain? Or*ln can the heavens grant showers? Is*ln it not You, O Lord*s our God? Therefore*ln we hope in You, For*ln You are the one who has done all these things.
